thread.title_full: HIGH SCHOOL BOYS BASKETBALL: Michael DiMarino named new boys hoop coach at Hamilton-Wenham | High School Insider | with Danny Ventura & Jim Clark | Boston Herald

author: Dan Ventura
title: HIGH SCHOOL BOYS BASKETBALL: Michael DiMarino named new boys hoop coach at Hamilton-Wenham | High School Insider | with Danny Ventura & Jim Clark
text:
Hamilton-Wenham announced that Michael DiMarino has been named the school's next head boys varsity basketball Coach. DiMarino replaces Doug Hoak, who retired after leading the Generals to the Division 4 state title last year.
 DiMarino comes to Hamilton-Wenham from Winthrop High School where he headed up the Vikings program the last three years. Prior to that, DiMarino honed his craft and developed relationships in the Cape Ann League as Masconomet's junior varsity Coach for four seasons. An award winning history teacher at Revere's Rumney Marsh Academy, DiMarino graduated from Bridgewater State and earned a Master's Degree of Education from Salem State.
 " Michael's previous experiences as a head varsity coach, his chosen career as an educator and the dozens of people that reached out to speak on his behalf, let us know he was the right person for the job," athletic director Craig Genauldo said in a press release.
